Info Source: Taken from the Federal Railroad Administration's FY2005 safety penalty report obtained through a Freedom of Information Act request. A copy is available upon request.
Taken from the Federal Railroad Administration's FY2000 safety penalty report obtained through a Freedom of Information Act request. A copy is available upon request.

Company: ENRON LIQUID FUELS CO (EX. UPC INC)
Agency: Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration

Description: The U.S. Commodity Futures Trading Commission announced a consent order of permanent injunction prohibiting violations of the Commodity Exchange Act and granting other relief against Enron Corp., including a $35 million civil penalty. The consent order resolved all charges brought by the CFTC against Enron.

Info Source: Included in a dataset downloaded at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Company is plan administrator. Penalty amount reported in range of $10,001 to $50,000.

Info Source: Included in a dataset downloaded at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Company is plan administrator. Penalty amount reported in range of $10,001 to $50,000.

Description: The attorneys general of California, Washington and Oregon announced a $1.52 billion settlement with Enron to resolve allegations of market manipulation and price gouging during the energy crisis of 2000-01.

The Connecticut Resources Recovery Authority received a $111.2 million bankruptcy settlement, stemming from a deal the CRRA's former management made with Enron that was alleged to be an illegal loan camouflaged as an energy deal.

Info Source: Attorney General Abbott Collects $8.3 Million in Back Taxes from Enron Companies, US States News, December 7, 2005 (via Nexis).

Description: The Staff alleges that EPMI violated the Protocols and compromised public policy and frustrated the regulatory scheme by engaging in anti-competitive behavior in the emerging ERCOT market.

Info Source: Extracted from a download of the EPA's Enforcement and Compliance History Online (ECHO) ICIS FE&C file downloaded on 3/02/2022, available at http://echo.epa.gov/tools/data-downloads#downloads
